title: [K-12] Peer Review Workshop for Formative Assessment in Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design concepts and digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Participants are general citizens without prior social education program development experience but interested in solving community issues; pre-learning materials are accessible via digital devices and online platforms

learning_goals: Verify the consistency (objectives-content-assessment) of instructional design documents through a peer review process

Using a structured feedback tool (5-step feedback frame: strengths-improvement points-specific suggestions-examples-questions), learners can propose at least two concrete improvements for peer design plans and receive evaluations of 3.0+ (5-point scale) in clarity and feasibility from peers.
Revise and refine draft instructional designs by incorporating formative assessment results
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
